title: Porticus Octaviae
description: A porticus in the area of the Circus Flaminius, the Porticus Octaviae was dedicated by Augustus sometime after 27 B.C. in honor of his sister, Octavia Minor. The porticus replaced the Porticus Metelli. It was restored twice after major urban fires in A.D. 80 and 203.

properties.description: Representative location based on an OpenStreetMap way that defines the limit of the area of visible, extant architectural remains.
properties.title: OSM location of Porticus Octaviae
